FAQs_Left.Question: What is a virtual hackathon? How does it operate?
FAQs_Left.Answer: Whether you're just getting started or you've been programming since an early age, virtual hackathons are a great place to learn new skills, build your network, find jobs, and have fun! We have been hard at work to create a memorable and fun virtual experience for everyone, whether you are an experienced hacker or a first-timer!

FAQs_Left.Question: Is there a theme for this event?
FAQs_Left.Answer: Yes, the theme for this event is "Embracing Uncertainty"! We're focusing on ways to utilize technology to stay healthy, connected, and happy during these unprecedented times.

FAQs_Left.Question: Who is eligible to participate?
FAQs_Left.Answer: This hackathon is for women (cis & trans) and non-binary partcipants only. Men are welcome to mentor, volunteer, judge, or participate as sponsors! You must be 16 years or older to participate in this event. There are no location restrictions!

FAQs_Left.Question: Is there a cost to attend? Will there be food?
FAQs_Left.Answer: Nothing! Thanks to our amazing sponsors, this event is free for all to attend. Because we are virtual this year, we will not be providing food, but we are working hard to provide everyone with fun gifts instead!

FAQs_Left.Question: What resources will I need in order to participate?
FAQs_Left.Answer: In order to build your project, you'll likely need a computer and whatever software you feel might be necessary for development. You'll also need a webcam and reliable internet connection to present your hard work to judges and other interested community members! We want everyone to have fun and get the most out of this event, so please reach out if you have any difficulty obtaining the resources you need!

FAQs_Left.Question: What if I don't have access to the internet/a computer?
FAQs_Left.Answer: No worries! Just let us know by filling out the Tech Request Form (in the Get Involved section) and we will try to get you the resources you need to participate.

FAQs_Left.Question: How do I register as a hacker and when is the deadline?
FAQs_Left.Answer: We're so excited! Please refer to the Get Involved section for the hacker registration form.

FAQs_Left.Question: What if I don't have a team? Do I need one?
FAQs_Left.Answer: While you have the option to work alone, TechTogether is a team event, so we encourage everyone to work in teams! Don't worry if you don't have a team—you'll have plenty of opportunities to find one virtually! TechTogether will be hosting a variety of team formation activities throughout the first day, and we will also have a Discord channel dedicated to team formation leading up to and during the event.

FAQs_Left.Question: How many people can be on a team?
FAQs_Left.Answer: All teams must be between 3-6 people. We highly encourage that advanced hackers bring on beginner hackers to mentor throughout the event.

FAQs_Left.Question: How long is the hackathon? When does it start and end?
FAQs_Left.Answer: This event will take place December 4-6! Please note that all events will follow Eastern Time (GMT-4).

FAQs_Right.Question: Can we start work on the project beforehand?
FAQs_Right.Answer: You are welcome to brainstorm ideas before the actual event! All projects should be built from scratch, meaning you should not work on any previous projects.

FAQs_Right.Question: What if I have never been to a hackathon before?
FAQs_Right.Answer: Not a problem at all! We eagerly welcome first-time hackers looking to try something new. Hackathons are really a place for learning and one of the best ways to do so. We'll have a series of workshops to bootstrap you for hacking, and when you run into any problems or questions, mentors will be happy to help you out. By the time you walk out, you will have new skills, friends, and a project under your belt!

FAQs_Right.Question: What if I have no coding experience?
FAQs_Right.Answer: Don't worry! We actively encourage people from all backgrounds, disciplines, and majors to attend! We have workshops that'll teach you everything you need to know. You will also have access to our mentors and the TechTogether team at all times! Just bring yourself, a willingness to learn, and a positive attitude!

FAQs_Right.Question: What if I don't have an idea?
FAQs_Right.Answer: Not to worry! We will have plenty of team-building workshops and mentors to help you brainstorm and bring your idea to life.

FAQs_Right.Question: Will I need to pitch my idea? What if I don't know how to?
FAQs_Right.Answer: Yes! If you don't know how to, don't worry! We will have a pitching workshop to help you prepare!

FAQs_Right.Question: What kinds of workshops and speakers will be present?
FAQs_Right.Answer: We will have workshops and speakers covering a variety of topics, including technical skills, career development, mental health, and social activities. More details coming soon in a Tentative Schedule section.

FAQs_Right.Question: What prizes can I win?
FAQs_Right.Answer: Yes, but there's a little twist! The grand prizes are donations under your name to charities and causes! There will be other company sponsored prizes as well!

FAQs_Right.Question: How will judging take place virtually?
FAQs_Right.Answer: Your team will have the option to present their projects to judges live or through a previously submitted video. If your team opts for a live presentation, you will have 2-3 minutes to present to the judge assigned to your team over Zoom.

FAQs_Right.Question: I want to volunteer, mentor, or judge! How can I help?
FAQs_Right.Answer: Awesome! Please refer to the Get Involved section for forms to register as a mentor or judge.

FAQs_Right.Question: How do I become a sponsor of TTNY?
FAQs_Right.Answer: Fantastic! Please refer to the Get Involved section for a sponsor interest form. Alternatively, reach out to sponsor.ny@techtogether.io.
